page.title: 02 THE LOCAL QUARRY
page.content: BULWELL QUARRY Bulwell stone is sedimentary rock because when it was under the sea layers and layers of magnesium limestone made up the sedimentary rock.Bulwell is very popular for its limestone it can be used for many things,like walls,crazy paving, buildings,roads,and for its lime.Mr. Sankey found some red clay and used it for plant pots. Some people burnt the sedimentary rock to get the lime out they were called limeburners. they did this in the 1450's.The biggest use of the Quarry rock is to make the underlayer of roads.They use a black crusher machine so they will get crush into little peices.Bulwell was under water.When the sea went back rivers flowed to the sea leaving mud and ooze which made limestone.
